supportDesc.support: Upper part of a moulded stele. marble

layoutDesc.layout: The left down part of the inscription is lost. A spherical restoration of the text, comes from parallels texts of other inscriptions.

handNote.seg: The letters are quite clear with no special difficulty on reading the inscribred text; there are occasional serifs on letters alpha, pi, chi, sigma, heta, ni and tau. The hasta of heta just tends to the above part of the letter; alpha with slanting crossbar. Omega tends to be occasionally smaller than other letters, finishing with two horizontal strokes on its both sides; the middle hasta of epsilon is shorter than them on the top and bottom. Tau appears to have an extended horizontal stroke with its vertical stroke to tend to the right.

origin.origPlace: Found in 2003 and reused in workshops' wall on the north side of bouleterion, to the south of Aphrodite's temple.

div.p: Proposal of the magistrates; because Damokrines the Rhodian,was sent over from Rhodians as a commander of the Carian places genuinely and with hostile sentiments, he changed the behaviour/layout of demos who was sent to him as it was deserved, thinking that all the demoi? will take the ultimate initiative from the situation and will take part in the government in corcondance. Being present at our city, he changed over the behaviour of them who were different from the citizens with integral diligence.

Απόφαση των ανώτερων αρχόντων. Επειδή ο Δαμοκρίνης ο Ρόδιος, στάλθηκε από τους Ροδίους , ηγέτης για τους τόπους στην Καρία χωρίς κανένα ελλάτωμα και χωρίς μίσος και πονηριά, άλλαξε με αξιοκρατία την συμπεριφορά στον λαό που του είχε σταλθεί, νοούμενος ότι όλοι οι πολίτες να υπάρχουν και να αναβιώνουν το ύψιστο της κατάστασης και να συμμετέχουν στα κοινά με ομόνοια. Ήταν παρών στην πόλη μας λοιπόν και έκανε την αλλαγή με όλη του την φροντίδα για τους πολίτες που ήταν διαφορετικοί.

It is an honorific decree for Damokrines, a commnander from the island of Rhodes in Karia (c. 188-167 BC). There are other decrees as well that foreign communities established in the area of Aphrodisias (probably close to the temple of Aphrodite). As a result , the decree itself indicates that Aphrodisias was being declared "polis" during its occupation from Rhodians. It is worth mentioning that the use of the vocabulary of the decree is meritorious as it contains elements of the citizenship of the area, who was the ruler and generally indications about the history of Aphrodisias in terms of geography and domination of the ancient place.

2-3. The formula "ἀποσταλεὶς ὑπὸ Ῥοδίων ἡγεμών ἐπὶ τῶν κατὰ Καρίαν τόπων" shows the function of the Rhodian officers. According to C. Reger, it is generally believed that Rhodians had embedded an administrative structure at Karia. However , because of the lack of resources there is a field of different views. In general, Rhodian and Seleukid practices both influenced the administration of Karia. The phraseology is notorious; the title of someone as a Rhodian commander is proved with the expression ἡγεμὼν/ἁγεμὼν ἐπὶ Καρίας. From a general perspective, the vocabulary and the phrases used in the inscription are imporant and worth to be mentioned and stessed out for a better understanding of the text.
Van Bremen, R. and Carbon, J.-M. (2010) Hellenistic Caria, Paris: Ausonius Éditions.
